pr_title: CLDR-13918 Moving old (used once) PathUtilities file to make way for new version.

timeline.bodyText:
Ordering is very very odd here. The array is being defined before the constants in it are defined.
Normally IntelliJ would warn about this, but it wasn't. Maybe array initialization is different.
I reordered the constants to ensure everything is defined top-to-bottom.
timeline.author: hagbard

timeline.bodyText: This is the only method called from outside this class. Everything else can be made private (or deleted because it's unused).
timeline.author: hagbard

timeline.bodyText:
This was all kinds of weird since the map is never written to so was always empty.
It'd have more thoughts on this if I wasn't able to just delete the whole method.
timeline.author: hagbard

timeline.bodyText: We could adapt the API so it handled "null" and returned "general" as a default, but I'm not even sure if this code is being used.
timeline.author: hagbard

timeline.bodyText: I search all Java files in the CLDR project and these strings aren't referenced anywhere.
timeline.author: hagbard

replies.bodyText:
Actually they are referenced in menu_top.jsp. I'm not sure whether there is any ill-effect other than these "problems" reported by Eclipse:
CALENDARS_ITEMS cannot be resolved or is not a field	menu_top.jsp	/cldr-apps/WebContent/WEB-INF/tmpl	line 5	JSP Problem
METAZONES_ITEMS cannot be resolved or is not a field	menu_top.jsp	/cldr-apps/WebContent/WEB-INF/tmpl	line 6	JSP Problem

Ideally we should stop using jsp files entirely. In the meantime we should clean up menu_top.jsp by removing the useless references to CALENDARS_ITEMS and METAZONES_ITEMS.
replies.author: btangmu

replies.bodyText:
Ahh good spot, thanks. JSP strikes again.
I'll have a look and see about putting another PR together.
replies.author: hagbard
